amilial isolated hyperparathyroidism ?,The prevalence of familial isolated hyperparathyroidism is unknown.,GHR,familial isolated hyperparathyroidism
What are the genetic changes related to familial isolated hyperparathyroidism ?,"Familial isolated hyperparathyroidism can be caused by mutations in the MEN1, CDC73, or CASR gene.  The MEN1 gene provides instructions for producing a protein called menin. Menin acts as a tumor suppressor, which means it normally keeps cells from growing and dividing
